title: Why pyridoxal phosphate could be a functional predecessor of thiamine pyrophosphate and speculations on a primordial metabolism
content:
RSC Chem. Biol., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4CB00016A, Review Article

On the basis of mechanistic and biosynthetic considerations, arguments are put forward as to why, from an evolutionary point of view, the coenzyme pyridoxal phosphate preceded thiamine pyrophosphate.
